item.title: 泰国 B. Grimm Power 公司和新加坡 Digital Edge 公司将投资 10 亿美元建设泰国数据中心
item.description: 泰国 B. Grimm Power Pcl 和新加坡数字基础设施公司 Digital Edge 周一发表声明称，两家公司将投资 10 亿美元在泰国建设一个 100 兆瓦的数据中心。【原文：Thai B. Grimm Power Pcl and Singaporean digital infrastructure firm Digital Edge will invest $1 billion in a 100-megawatt data centre in Thailand, the companies said in a statement on Monday.】

item.title: 受人工智能需求和美国关税影响，台湾 5 月出口创历史新高
item.description: 由于人工智能需求的蓬勃发展，以及客户在美国关税生效前下订单，台湾的出口在 5 月份飙升至创纪录水平。【原文：Taiwan's exports surged to a record in May on booming demand for artificial intelligence and as customers placed orders ahead of U.S. tariffs which could take effect next month after a suspension period expires.】

item.title: 中国 5 月汽车销量增长，但价格战给前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 中国 5 月份汽车销量连续第四个月增长，但主要汽车制造商的销量增长速度放缓，凸显了人们对全球最大汽车市场激烈价格竞争的担忧。【原文：China's May car sales rose for a fourth consecutive month, but slower sales rises across major automakers, although the pace of growth slowed, highlighting concerns over aggressive price competition in the world’s largest auto market.】

item.title: 量子计算公司 IonQ 将以 10.8 亿美元收购英国牛津离子公司
item.description: 总部位于马里兰州的量子计算公司 IonQ 周一表示，将以 10.75 亿美元的价格收购英国量子计算初创公司 Oxford Ionics。【原文：IonQ will acquire British quantum computing startup Oxford Ionics for $1.075 billion, the Maryland-based quantum computing firm said on Monday.】

item.title: 花旗集团放弃美国 7 月降息押注，将预期下调至 75 个基点
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup）将美国降息预期从 7 月份推迟到了 9 月份，现在预计今年将降息三次，而不是四次，因为在劳动力市场降温的情况下，5 月份就业报告强于预期。【原文：Citigroup has pushed back its U.S. rate cut forecast to September from July and now expects three cuts this year instead of four, after a stronger-than-expected May jobs report in an otherwise cooling labor market.】

item.title: Rednote 加入中国企业发布开源人工智能模型的浪潮
item.description: 中国最受欢迎的社交媒体平台之一红记发布了一个开源的大型语言模型，加入了中国科技公司免费提供人工智能模型的浪潮。【原文：China's Rednote, one of the country's most popular social media platforms, has released an open-source large language model, joining a wave of Chinese tech firms making their artificial intelligence models freely available.】

item.title: 英国金融监管机构与英伟达合作开发人工智能 "沙盒
item.description: 英国金融监管部门周一推出了一个监管 "沙盒"，今年晚些时候，英国的金融公司将可以在 "沙盒 "中测试人工智能工具，这是政府支持创新和经济增长的更广泛战略的一部分。【原文：Financial firms in Britain will be able to test artificial intelligence tools later this year in a regulatory "sandbox" launched on Monday by the country's financial watchdog, part of a broader government strategy to support innovation and economic growth.】

item.title: 欧莱雅收购英国护肤品牌 Medik8
item.description: 欧莱雅的所有者、英国私募股权公司 Inflexion 周一表示，欧莱雅将收购英国护肤品牌 Medik8，这将增强这家法国化妆品巨头在快速增长的皮肤科护肤品市场上的实力。【原文：L'Oreal is to acquire British skincare brand Medik8, its owner, Britain-based private equity firm Inflexion, said on Monday, boosting the French cosmetics giant's offering in the fast-growing dermatological skincare market.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，Shein 和 Reliance 的目标是在一年内将印度制造的服装销往国外
item.description: 两位知情人士称，时装零售商 Shein 和合作伙伴 Reliance Retail 计划迅速扩大其印度供应商基地，并在 6 至 12 个月内开始在海外销售印度制造的 Shein 品牌服装。【原文：Fashion retailer Shein and partner Reliance Retail plan to rapidly expand their Indian supplier base and start overseas sales of India-made Shein-branded clothes within six to 12 months, said two people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 高通公司以 24 亿美元收购 Alphawave，加强人工智能产品组合
item.description: 美国芯片制造商高通公司（Qualcomm）周一同意以约 24 亿美元的价格收购英国半导体公司 Alphawave，以加强其人工智能技术。【原文：U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm on Monday agreed to acquire British semiconductor company Alphawave for about $2.4 billion as part of efforts to strengthen its artificial intelligence technology.】

item.title: 联系汇率飞涨：特朗普引发的动荡冲击港元和利率
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普反复无常的政策正在动摇经受住了时间考验并被视为中国和亚洲锚的货币联系。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's erratic policies are rattling a currency peg that has withstood the test of time and is seen as an anchor for China and Asia.】

item.title: 中国五月贷款因货币措施和贸易休战而增加三倍
item.description: 由于中美之间暂时的贸易休战和政府的新措施帮助刺激了信贷需求，5 月份中国新增人民币贷款比一个月前增加了两倍多，与去年同期的借贷需求相当。【原文：China's new yuan loans more than tripled in May compared with a month ago, matching the borrowing appetite in the same period last year, as a temporary trade truce between China and the United States and new government measures helped boost credit demand.】

item.title: 盖蒂在英国就版权和人工智能提起的具有里程碑意义的诉讼即将开庭
item.description: 盖蒂图片公司（Getty Images）对人工智能公司 Stability AI 提起的具有里程碑意义的版权诉讼周一在伦敦高等法院开庭，这家图片提供商的案件可能会为人工智能法律开创一个重要先例。【原文：Getty Images' landmark copyright lawsuit against artificial intelligence company Stability AI begins at London's High Court on Monday, with the photo provider's case likely to set a key precedent for the law on AI.】

item.title: 汽车公司因稀土瓶颈 "陷入全面恐慌
item.description: 最近几周，德国一家磁铁制造商的首席执行官弗兰克-艾卡德（Frank Eckard）接到了大量电话。气急败坏的汽车制造商和零部件供应商迫切希望找到磁铁的替代货源，因为中国的出口限制导致磁铁供不应求。【原文：Frank Eckard, CEO of a German magnet maker, has been fielding a flood of calls in recent weeks. Exasperated automakers and parts suppliers have been desperate to find alternative sources of magnets, which are in short supply due to Chinese export curbs.】

item.title: 早间竞价市场寄希望于伦敦贸易谈判
item.description: 洛基-斯威夫特对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rocky Swift】

item.title: 华盛顿优先事项发生变化，美国太阳能增长放缓
item.description: 据一家顶级太阳能贸易集团周一发布的一份报告称，由于美国联邦政策转向倾向于化石燃料、关税和其他挑战，预计未来五年美国太阳能新装机量将下降。【原文：New U.S. solar energy installations are expected to fall over the next five years as the industry grapples with a shift in federal policy that favors fossil fuels, tariffs and other challenges, according to a report published on Monday by a top solar trade group.】

item.title: 尽管有出口限制，中国 5 月稀土出口仍猛增 23
item.description: 中国 5 月份稀土出货量环比增长 23%，达到一年来的最高水平，尽管中国政府对部分关键矿产的出口限制导致一些海外销售停止，但稀土短缺已波及全球制造业。【原文：China's outbound shipments of rare earths in May jumped 23% on the month to their highest in a year, though Beijing's export curbs on some of the critical minerals halted some overseas sales, with shortages rippling through global manufacturing.】

item.title: 中国 5 月份大豆进口量较 4 月份增加；原油、煤炭和石油进口量下降
item.description: 周一的海关数据显示，中国 5 月份的大豆进口量环比上升，而原油、煤炭和铁矿石的进口量则有所下降。【原文：China's imports of soybeans rose in May from a month earlier, while those of crude oil, coal, and iron ore dropped, customs data showed on Monday.】

item.title: 关税战趋于缓和，波音飞机返回中国交货
item.description: 飞行跟踪数据显示，一架新的波音737 MAX飞机周一重新降落在中国，这表明随着北京和华盛顿关税战的缓和，这家美国飞机制造商正在恢复向中国客户的交付。【原文：A new Boeing 737 MAX landed back in China on Monday, flight tracking data showed, a sign the U.S. planemaker was resuming deliveries to Chinese customers as Beijing and Washington ease their tariff war.】

item.title: 中国 5 月出口放缓，通货紧缩因关税而加深
item.description: 由于美国加征关税，中国5月份出口增长放缓至三个月来的最低点，同时工厂通货紧缩加深至两年来最严重的水平，这给世界第二大经济体带来了内外两方面的压力。【原文：China's May exports growth slowed to a three-month low as U.S. tariffs slammed shipments, while factory-gate deflation deepened to its worst level in two years, heaping pressure on the world's second-largest economy on both the domestic and external fronts.】

item.title: 星巴克在中国降低部分饮品价格
item.description: 星巴克周一在其微信社交媒体账户上发布了一篇文章，称将在中国把部分冰饮的价格平均下调 5 元（0.70 美元）。【原文：Starbucks will lower prices of some iced drinks by an average of 5 yuan ($0.70) in China, the company said in a post published on its Weixin social media account on Monday.】

item.title: 中美谈判前亚洲股市攀升，美元走软
item.description: 周一，亚洲市场对好于预期的美国就业数据做出了反应，在伦敦举行的旨在修补中美贸易裂痕的会谈之前，股市跳涨，美元收窄了近期涨幅。【原文：Shares jumped and the dollar pared recent gains on Monday as Asian markets reacted to better-than-expected U.S. jobs data ahead of talks in London aimed at mending a trade rift between the United States and China.】

item.title: 中国工厂门通缩为 22 个月来最严重，经济逆风加剧
item.description: 5 月份，中国生产者通货紧缩加深，达到近两年来最严重的水平，而消费者价格跌幅扩大，因为中国经济正努力应对贸易紧张局势和长期住房低迷带来的不利因素。【原文：China's producer deflation deepened to its worst level in almost two years in May while consumer prices extended declines, as the economy grappled with headwinds from trade tensions and a prolonged housing downturn.】

item.title: 中美贸易谈判前油价保持涨势
item.description: 由于投资者在等待当天晚些时候将在伦敦举行的中美贸易谈判，油价在周一早盘守住了上周的涨幅。【原文：Oil prices held on to last week's gains early on Monday as investors waited for U.S.-China trade talks to be held in London later in the day.】

item.title: 美元反弹后企稳，焦点转向中美贸易谈判
item.description: 美元兑所有主要货币周一持稳，原因是对乐观的美国就业报告的欣喜让位于对当天晚些时候将在伦敦举行的关键性中美贸易谈判的谨慎。【原文：The dollar held steady against all major currencies on Monday, as exuberance over an upbeat U.S. employment report gave way to caution ahead of pivotal U.S.-China trade talks set to take place in London later in the day.】

item.title: 修正后的数据显示，日本第一季度国内生产总值收缩幅度因消费改善而收窄
item.description: 日本政府周一公布的数据显示，1-3 月份日本经济的萎缩程度低于最初的估计，其中消费数据被上调，而此时围绕美国关税的不确定性正在给经济前景蒙上阴影。【原文：Japan's economy contracted less than initially estimated in the January-March quarter, government data showed on Monday, with consumption figures revised upwards at a time when uncertainty surrounding U.S. tariffs is clouding the outlook.】

item.title: 中美关键贸易谈判定于周一在伦敦举行
item.description: 美国和中国的高级官员将于周一在伦敦举行会谈，旨在化解这两个超级大国之间高风险的贸易争端，这种争端在最近几周已经从针锋相对的关税扩大到对全球供应链至关重要的商品和零部件的出口管制。【原文：Top U.S. and Chinese officials will sit down in London on Monday for talks aimed at defusing the high-stakes trade dispute between the two superpowers that has widened in recent weeks beyond tit-for-tat tariffs to export controls over goods and components critical to global supply chains.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Meta 正在洽谈规模 AI 投资，投资额可能高达 100 亿美元
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周日报道，Meta Platforms 正在洽谈对人工智能初创公司 Scale AI 的投资，金额可能超过 100 亿美元。【原文：Meta Platforms is in talks to make an investment that could exceed $10 billion in artificial intelligence startup Scale AI, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 特朗普称马斯克若资助民主党候选人将面临 "非常严重的后果" -NBC 新闻
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周六在接受 NBC 新闻采访时表示，如果亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克资助民主党候选人与投票支持特朗普全面减税法案的共和党人竞选，将会产生 "严重后果"。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump, in an interview with NBC News on Saturday, said there would be "serious consequences" if billionaire Elon Musk funds Democratic Party candidates to run against Republicans who vote for Trump's sweeping tax-cut bill.】

item.title: 格林：英格兰银行对通胀驼峰 "并不乐观
item.description: 英国央行货币政策制定者梅根-格林（Megan Greene）周六表示，英国央行仍预计英国通胀持续上升的势头将减弱，但在价格增长被证明比几年前预期的更为持久之后，英国央行对此 "并不乐观"。【原文：The Bank of England still expects the ongoing rise in UK inflation to fade but is "not sanguine" about it after price growth proved more persistent than anticipated only a few years ago, BoE monetary policymaker Megan Greene said on Saturday.】
